Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [previously on The Office...]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am on a lecture circuit. I'm goin' around to all the branches, and I'm telling them my secret recipe for success.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have now memorized all of your names. Shirty, Mole, Lazy Eye, Mexico, Baldy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding a chainsaw] And I turn it on and I say 'Prepare yourself for the Utica Chainsaw Massacre.'

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: How's Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I'm so happy for you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You remember Holly? She used to work for HR? She's the love of my life. She just left... and I never got closure. And I feel like I need to go to Nashua and get closure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... Okay, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Kevin is holding two ice cream treats] Two?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I didn't eat lunch. [Oscar gives Kevin a look] I didn't eat all my lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [enters smiling and waving] Hello, everyone. Oh, ice cream. Nice, Kevin. Looks good.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It... yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, you're more chipper than usual.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I am proud to announce that there is a new addition to the Martin family. [takes a breath, excitedly] She's hypoallergenic. She doesn't struggle when you try to dress her. She's a third-generation show cat. Her father was in 'Meet the Parents.' Needless to say, she was very, very expensive.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How much?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Seven thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: For a cat? I could get you a kid for that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Where'd you get that kind of money?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I sold Andy's engagement ring on eBay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, you didn't give it back?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He wouldn't have wanted that. Her name is Princess Lady!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Seven grand?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I gotta see that little bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have something better than a picture. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have your cats on Nanny-Cam?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah. [cats meowing] I mean, I usually try to take leave when I get a new cat, but I'm out of vacation days. And this company still doesn't recognize cat maternity. I mean, when somebody has a kid, oh sure, take off a year.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She's right. I had my second kid just for the vacation.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Right. Anyways... I just want to make sure Princess Lady is acclimating well. She means more to me than anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Any cat, you mean.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And person.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, detour. We're now adding Nashua to the Lecture Circuit so Michael can confront Holly and get some closure. Nashua actually sounded very excited on the phone. I don't think they get a lot of visitors. Because their office is only accessible by cross-country skis. Hey-oh! [laughs] [whispers] I've been driving too long.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shouts from another room] What did you do?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Stop yelling at me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you do?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I didn't do anything!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you learn in there? I bet you learned things, huh? Like how to fashion a shiv, hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! What the hell's goin' on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you tell Jim where you were from ages 14 to 15.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was kickin' it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In juvie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Juvie... nile... Detention Center. Where they send teenagers!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For reha-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you do? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight, sounds like she was 14, so maybe we wanna go a little easy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, if she's old enough to get married, she's old enough to follow the law. [to Kelly] What did you do?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: My boyfriend dumped me, so, I stole his boat. I mean, he told me it was his boat. It was actually his father's. And I just thought it'd be really romantic, like 'Thelma and Louise,' but with, like, a boat. And it was the worst year of my life. And I can't believe that you guys are making me talk about this on my birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought you said yesterday was your birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? I got you a cake.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You did? I wanna see the cake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And... ta da.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I hate it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How do you hate it? It's a cake.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, there's no flowers... or toys... or-- I mean, there's nothing on it. Where did you even find a cake like this? I mean, it doesn't have my name on it! Do you guys know what my name is? My name is Kelly!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I forgot if there was an "e" between the "l" and the "y." I still don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean, I don't even know what the theme is. What's the theme?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Frosting.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Those aren't... themes. There's always a theme. [walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: There's always a theme.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice job on the cake, Bozo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what, next time, I'll let you get the cake and I get to scream at the birthday girl.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [taking Michael's picture] Okay, a little bit more closer to the sign. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I look okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You look good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Hi, can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, you can. I am, uh, Michael Scott, Regional Manager of the Scranton branch.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Yes, we were expecting you. Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. ... Um... is, uh, Holly Flax anywhere here?

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Actually, she's on an HR retreat for the next three days.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh- She's not here?

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: But, if you need to get in touch with her immediately, you could talk to A.J. He's a salesman here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A.J.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's her boyfriend. He's just over there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She has a boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How could she do this to me, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's not doing it to hurt you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't do the presentation, I can't- [voice cracks] ... just... oh... thinking about seeing him... and... thinking about... him getting to hold her and getting to kiss her, it just- oh, God! [starts crying, covers his face]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Listen, when Jim was dating Karen, I didn't want to come to work. It was awful. I hated it. I wanted to quit, but-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, just... uh, please, I'm going through something, okay? [exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, when Holly gets back, everyone will tell her what a great job you did. And then she'll realize what she's missing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And then she'll move back to Scranton. And her boyfriend will die.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe. One step at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It could be snacks, or-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why would we- [cats meowing from Angela's computer, sounds like crying]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wha-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Is that what I think it is? [Kevin and Oscar get up and go to Angela's computer]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good God!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That one ugly cat is humping Princess Lady!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it, Mr. Ash! Bad cat! That is very bad! You stop it right now! I swear, he is fixed.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know fixed; that ain't fixed.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, now listen. You can't let what you see here, sully your image of them. They are good, decent cats. [all laugh] I gotta go. I'll be back in an hour. Oh, stop that! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, the other one's watching.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so all we need is a theme... and cups, and ice, and punch, and a cake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Busy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, what's that show that she's always talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Is this how you are with Pam? 'Cause she must want to shoot herself in the face.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? I could use a little help.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? I'm a little busy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We have a lot to do, and you are... putting up a very effeminate sign. Is that what you've been doing, is making a sign?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not effeminate. It's festive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've been making that sign, for something that we could just announce to the whole office? Hey everybody, the party's now at 3!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I know, I just read it on the sign.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Goooood morning, Viet-Nashua! Sales. Sales is what bwings us together, today. How do we deal with clients who say, "Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn... about paper" and get them to "Show us the money!" Well, we are going to find out today. Show of hands. How many of you are salesmen? Let's see the salesmen. [some raise their hands] Oh, okay. Well I know what the rest of you are thinking. Wow, yuck. Salesmen are the worst! They are awful. They are so arrogant. They think the whole place revolves around them. Handsome, good listeners, funny, Mr. Wonderful. So, okay, you're a salesman. What's, uh, what's your name?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: A.J.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A.J. What kind of name is A.J.?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you race cars?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: [laughs] I'm a salesman. That's why I raised my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ooh. Ouch. Okay, good. You're funny, very good and funny. Tell me, A.J., are you dating? Is there somebody you date?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: Yeah. Why, are you interested? [all laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: I have a question about discounts from distributors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, we will get to you. Okay, so you're dating somebody? Um... is it serious?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: It's pretty serious, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh- [pauses] Does she ever talk about me? [voice cracking]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: What does this have to do with sales?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's all connected. Shut up. [to A.J.] Does she ever mention 'Michael Scott?'

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: No, what are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs loudly] Does it feel good?

Quote.Speaker: A.J.
Quote.Text: Does what feel good?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [grunts] Your life. [sits down, upset] Oh, wow. Whew. Ahh, legs are sorta giving out. Long drive in the car, so let's just- We'll just continue. [sighs, falls to floor, gets more upset] Oh, wow. [takes deep breath] Ooh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, get off the floor!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah... uh, I can't do this Pam. Just read from- just read the cards.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] No, no, no, you have to do it-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, I'm okay. I'm all right. [sighs heavily] Okay... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That was weird, huh? It's all part of the presentation. It was confusing, right? Because confusing situations happen to us all the time in our jobs. [pauses] I'm just trying to bridge the gap between what just happened and the fact that I'm going to be doing the rest of the presentation. [reading from the cards, in Forrest Gump voice] Sales is like a box a chocolates, you never know which vendor you're gonna get. Forrest Gump.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pointing to staff members] Blazer. Freckles. Penguin. K.D. Lang. Holly's boyfriend. These mnemonic devices help to make a connection, and then, also to help you memorize names. I have a chainsaw! [holds up chainsaw, makes a wimpy chain saw noise] Cutting down the competition.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [cats meowing in background][on Nanny-Cam] Where is that bad cat? Oh, you know who you are. Excuse me, Petals, I'm looking for Mr. Ash. He's a bad cat. Bad, bad cat. Do you hear me? Bad. Yeah, you were bad. No, you look at me when I talk to you. Do you hear me, Mr. Ash? You look at me. 'Cause I'm talking to you right now.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [snickers]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [meows like a cat, then hisses]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is getting weird.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is she cleaning the cat with her tongue? [Angela licks cat, meows]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ohhh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs, touches Holly's sweater, cuts off sleeve, chuckles, sees Word document on Holly's computer named "Dear Michael," plugs in USB flash drive to copy file from computer]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [shivers] [meowing noises] Has this been on the entire time?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I was looking at pictures of food on my computer.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sigh of relief] Well, sorry I'm late. [clears throat, coughs, pulls hairball out of her mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I want to get that image out of my head. The psychological issues that go behind licking a cat, are not things I want to go into. Also, I'm pretty sure she coughed up a hairball.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [loading up car with Michael] Don't look up. Don't look up. [sighs as office workers all looking from window]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Want some pie?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I went through Holly's things.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I stole a sleeve of her sweater.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I also stole something off of her computer. A document called "Dear Michael."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You did what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I shouldn't have done it. It just- I couldn't help it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She never sent it to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, sh- she didn't. I'm gonna read it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, under no circumstances can you read that letter. It's a violation of her trust.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because, she didn't send it to you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know. You're right, you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I could read it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that wouldn't-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I could read it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you don't have to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Go get your laptop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [leaves to get laptop]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to camera] What? I'm not in love with her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [blowing up balloon, breathes loudly] You have to write my suggestions down, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not writing, "Horse Hunt." I don't even know what that means.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's in the name.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [grunts] Okay, so far, our ideal party consists of beer, fights to the death, cupcakes, blood pudding, blood, touch football, mating, charades, and yes, horse hunting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're right, forget horse hunting. It's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, is there a birthday you remember that you loved?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's one. It was dark, warm, wet. A sudden burst of light. An intense pressure like I'd never felt before. Father, dressed in white, pulls me forward. Mother bites the cord. [pretends to bite]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, stop. Forever stop that story. That's disgusting, and it doesn't count. So give me another one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Schrutes don't celebrate birthdays, idiot. It started as a Depression-era practicality, and then moved on to an awesome tradition that I look forward to every year. [rolls eyes] What about you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, when I was seven, my Dad took me to the Natural History Museum in New York. And we looked at fossils all day. And at the end of the day, he got me a little plastic triceratops. It was awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's cool. Hey, you know what's even cooler than triceratops? Every other dinosaur that ever existed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera] Didn't see that one coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [closes laptop] It's deleted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She still has feelings for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She said that? Is that what it said? What did it say?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't tell you specifically, but... it's not over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're sure?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [nods and smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [smiles, sighs, chuckles] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [enters conference room]

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Happy Birthday!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Surprise!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, it's not a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This doesn't look good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?! You have a cake. You have a delicious cake, with your name spelled correctly?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [shakes her head no]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Told you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You haven't heard our theme, though.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You don't hear a theme, you see it... why is there a chicklet on my cake?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's the best part. That represents a pillow, or a television.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Our theme, if you will.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because the fun part is, you get to decide on an hour of television, or an hour of napping.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's our theme.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [high-fives Jim] Oh, yes! Okay, good. So what's it gonna be, Kapoor?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh- can she pick a half hour of each?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, then pick TV.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Take a nap!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: TV.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, watching TV at work is really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Take a nap, nothing good is on TV right now.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Bonnie Hunt is on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You know what, I have been watching TV all week. I choose nap.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, nap it is! Everyone out! Get out! We're gonna be eating cake at our desks. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Move it! Let's go, go, go, go, go. I got this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahem. This is for you... and [puts blanket around her shoulders] ...Happy Birthday, Kel.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [giggles] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [turns off lights] Okay, you've got one hour. [shuts door]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm too excited to sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm, great cake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks. [both eat cake]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [opens door to wake Kelly, bangs together two trash can covers loudly] Birthday time is over! Now go make up for all the work you missed when you were taking your nap. [slaps Kelly's butt] Many happy returns. [slams door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I feel great. So good to have closure. Ah! We should go apologize to Roy or something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, we don't need to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who have I wronged? Who have I wronged? Oh, oh! What about that fat guy from Stamford that I insulted? We should find him!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You mean Tony?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jabba the hut, Pizza the hut, Fat guys like pizza, pepperoni pizza, pepperoni Tony!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man, was he fat. So, so... fat. You know what, forget it. I know me. When I saw him, I would never be able to apologize to him. Too fat. Big fat fatty.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: As you may know, I am no longer in a relationships. It's been really stressful here. So, I decided to treat myself to one of God's most perfect creations...a beautiful new cat! It's tacky to talk about money. But she cost seven thousand dollars!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [holds up cell phone showing video of Angela talking to her cats] For a rainy day. [laughs]
